member.summary: Enum defines the different power levels supported by the RF231 radio

member.summary: Enum defines the different channels the RF231 radio can use

member.name: M:Samraksh.SPOT.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4.ReleaseMessage
member.summary: This function explicitly releases the message packet and is free to be collected by the gc. If this is not called, the packet is released during the next GetNextPacket call

member.name: M:Samraksh.SPOT.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4.GetNextPacket
member.summary: Get the next packet from the radio driver, the radio does not maintain a buffer, the onus is on the application to sample this data as quickly as possible on getting a recieve interrupt Otherwise the packet is overwritten in the radio layer, for buffer support use the mac interface
member.returns: A data packet of message type to the caller

member.name: M:Samraksh.SPOT.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4.Initialize(Samraksh.SPOT.Net.Radio.RadioConfiguration,Samraksh.SPOT.Net.ReceiveCallBack)
member.summary: Initialize native radio and interop drivers.
member.returns: The status after the method call: Success, Fail, Ready, Busy

member.name: M:Samraksh.SPOT.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4.Configure(Samraksh.SPOT.Net.Radio.RadioConfiguration,Samraksh.SPOT.Net.ReceiveCallBack)
member.returns: The status after the method call: Success, Fail, Ready, Busy
member.remarks: Used to change the Radio configuration during and after initialization, using this function can change the callback if a different callback is used. Please use reconfigure to change power and channel

member.summary: Set the transmit power of the 802.15.4 radio.

member.summary: Set the channel of the 802.15.4 radio.

member.name: M:Samraksh.SPOT.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4.SendTimeStamped(System.Byte[],System.UInt16,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Load and send a message, with radio layer time stamping.
member.returns: The result of the method: E_RadioInit, E_RadioSync, E_RadioConfig, E_MacInit, E_MacConfig, E_MacSendError, E_MacBufferFull, S_Success
member.remarks: The offset for the timestamp in the packet is specified by TimeStampOffset member of the RadioConfiguration structure passed as parameter during radio module initialization.
